dataset.title: Phytoplankton Data from the Eastern Continental Shelf Waters of the United States, Cape Hatteras to Gulf of Maine, 1979-1985

creator.organizationName: Department of Biological Sciences, Old Dominion University
Department of Biological Sciences, Old Dominion University

abstract.para:
This data set contains seasonal records of phytoplankton composition and abundance, from the eastern continental shelf waters of the United States (Cape Hatteras, N.C to Gulf of Maine). Predominantly surface (1-4m) water samples were taken (e.g. 828 total) along transects from near shore to the outer shelf during 32 cruises for phytoplankton analysis, along with accompanying station co-ordinates, salinity and temperature data. The time period represents ca. a two decade historical data set applicable to future comparative studies regarding climatic or other environmental changes associated with the phytoplankton presence in this oceanic region.
All water samples collected were analyzed at the Phytoplankton Analysis Laboratory at Old Dominion University, Norfolk, Virginia. The majority of the sampling came from vessels of the NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service programs that included Ocean Pulse and MARMAP. Accompanying publications presenting mean concentrations and volumes for species and algal categories across regions of the shelf, and specific distribution information are in the following references. These studies represent the most extensive and concentrated coverage of phytoplankton composition completed to date for this region.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Atlantic Ocean, eastern continental shelf from Cape Hatteras, NC to Gulf of Maine

contact.organizationName: Department of Biological Sciences, Old Dominion University

section.title: Collection
section.para: At each station standard hydrocasts were made with a 500 ml sample removed for microscopic phytoplankton analysis.

section.title: Preservation
section.para: These samples were preserved immediately with buffered formalin and stored in polyethylene bottles prior to laboratory analysis.

section.title: Analysis
section.para: A modified Uterm√∂hl method was used with an inverted plankton microscope at magnifications of 300X and 500X (Marshall 1984b).

description.para: This data set contains seasonal records of phytoplankton composition and abundance, from the eastern continental shelf waters of the United States (Cape Hatteras, N.C to Gulf of Maine). The time period represents ca. a two decade historical data set applicable to future comparative studies regarding climatic or other environmental changes associated with the phytoplankton presence in this oceanic region. All four seasons were represented in these collections.

samplingDescription.para: Predominantly surface (1-4m) water samples were taken (e.g. 828 total) along transects from near shore to the outer shelf during 32 cruises for phytoplankton analysis, along with accompanying station co-ordinates, salinity and temperature data.

dataTable.entityDescription: Phytoplankton data from the Eastern Continental Shelf 1979-1985

attribute.attributeDefinition: Taxonomic code assigned to unique phytoplankton taxa

textDomain.definition: unique ID code for each phytoplankton taxa

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of phytoplankton cells per liter
Latitude of sample collection in decimal degrees
Longitude of sample collection in decimal degrees
Depth of sample collection in meters
Water temperature at collection site in Celsius
Water salinity at collection site in parts per thousand

Phytoplankton taxonomic grouping. Groups used in this study are: Bacilliophyceans, Chlorophyceans, Chrysophyceans, Coccolithophores, Cryptophyceans, Cyanophyceans, Dinoflagellates, Euglenophyceans, Prasiniophyceans, Silicophyceans, Xanthophyceans, Others
Total number of phytoplankton cells per collection in cells per liter

unit.name: cellsPerLiter
unit.description: number of individual phytoplankton cells per liter

unit.name: totalcellsPerLiter
unit.description: total phytoplankton density (cells per Liter) for particular collection
